item.title: W
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“ninja nub, post:11, topic:195914”][quote author=xxlegitxx link=topic=260455.msg2162646#msg2162646 date=1207430458]

howbow, here’s some good advice for you. Buy a rope about the length of your arms raised up shoulder level extending from the sides of your body. After you get the correct length, follow a tutorial on how to tie a Hangman’s Noose. Once done with that part, find a good location to mount this noose. After doing so, proceed to stick your head through the noose. Tighten up accordingly. And raise your legs, or kick over whatever you used to stand on while you were getting into the noose. This will make sure the job is complete. Good luck.

I must add my words of advice. First, make sure the noose is well anchored. Ceiling fixtures have multiple points of weakness, so I would advise against such. A good sturdy tree branch is best, because anything else could cause more pain than necessary. Also, make sure the rope is high quality. Preferably, you should wax it or buy it pre-waxed, because rope burn is fairly irritating. In addition, a good, sturdy rope is essential, because if it breaks, it, too, could cause more trouble than necessary.
[/quote]

And if all else fails, try again.[/quote]
If all else fails, just jump infront of a fucking train, actually.

Read full topic

item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

ThAt0n36Uy:

howbow, here’s some good advice for you. Buy a rope about the length of your arms raised up shoulder level extending from the sides of your body. After you get the correct length, follow a tutorial on how to tie a Hangman’s Noose. Once done with that part, find a good location to mount this noose. After doing so, proceed to stick your head through the noose. Tighten up accordingly. And raise your legs, or kick over whatever you used to stand on while you were getting into the noose. This will make sure the job is complete. Good luck.

I must add my words of advice. First, make sure the noose is well anchored. Ceiling fixtures have multiple points of weakness, so I would advise against such. A good sturdy tree branch is best, because anything else could cause more pain than necessary. Also, make sure the rope is high quality. Preferably, you should wax it or buy it pre-waxed, because rope burn is fairly irritating. In addition, a good, sturdy rope is essential, because if it breaks, it, too, could cause more trouble than necessary.
